thread.title: Is this The Voice's best-named contestant EVER? Get ready to meet Septimus Prime
thread.title_full: Is this The Voice's best-named contestant EVER? Get ready to meet Septimus Prime

author: Suchandrika Chakrabarti
title: Is this The Voice's best-named contestant EVER? Get ready to meet Septimus Prime
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A former teen footballer forced to give up his dreams after a brush with death is set to light up The Voice's blind auditions tonight - and you won't forget his name in a hurry. 
19-year-old Septimus Prime was a rising star with Charlton Athletic Academy while he was at secondary school. 
Tragically, at the age of 15, he collapsed with a previously undiagnosed heart defect. 
After suffering chest pains,he woke up in hospital, only to be told by doctors that he had an irregular heartbeat. 
The condition sadly cut short his promising sports career. Septimus had to give up his beloved career (Photo: ITV) Septimus sings the classic Justin Bieber tune, 'Love Yourself' (Photo: ITV) Read More The Voice's Lawrence Hill admits he was "horrified" to find out will.i.am ACCIDENTALLY pressed his button 
Septimus is clearly thrilled about his new career move, saying: "Music is my life now. I love performing, I love singing." 
He's even got a few designs on the judges' jobs: "I want one of those chairs to turn around on so badly." 
Septimus will be singing Justin Bieber's hit tune 'Love Yourself' on tonight's show. Septimus had to sadly give up his youthful sporting career (Photo: ITV) Septimus says, "Music is my life now." (Photo: ITV) Read More 
Septimus Prime is well aware of the sheer fabulousness of his name, as his Twitter cover photo makes clear. 
He's already getting some supportive Twitter chat because of it: 
We've got to agree - with a name like that, he's surely set for stardom. poll loading Is Septimus Prime the best name you've ever heard? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
